item.title: Mathematical Modelling and Numerical Simulation in Medicine
item.description:
This page contains the talks given as part of the CIMPA Summer School on .

The talks were given under the theme “Examples and principles of mathematical modelling in medicine”

Microwave Ablation

The first lecture introduces the basic principles of mathematical modelling in medicine and the typical clinical workflow for image-guided therapies.

The curl-curl form of Maxwell’s equations are presented and the challenges in tractably computing the dose delivered in needle-based microwave ablation therapy presented.

The slides can be found .

Cryoablation

The second lecture presents cryoablation, and the requirements for computing the damage by cryotherapy. The challenges of model validation on clinical data are presented.

The slides can be found .

Ultrasound

The third lecture introduces the numerical challenges in modelling high-intensity focused ultrasound therapy, specifically focusing on the challenges posed by frequency-dependent powerlaw absorption for nonlinear wave propagation.

The slides can be found .

Exercises

Throughout the lectures a number of problems will be presented.

An set of collated problems can be found .

item.title: Artificial Intelligence in Therapeutic Ultrasound
item.description:
This talk aims at briefly introducing some key concepts in artificial intelligence which are relevant to therapeutic ultrasound.

It was delivered as an educational session at .

There were a number of challenges in writing this, mainly relating to the breadth of the possible applications and, at the same time introducing a number of technical concepts which needed to be defined. Many of the subject areas could have been lecture courses in their own right.

The abstract can be found [here]

The slides will be uploaded soon.
